message.mainText:
Klein und Haarig 
 —3 days of electronic music in an idyllic valley in the Black Forest.
message.secondaryText:
Organized fully voluntary by friends, the Bunte Platte e.V.

We want to create a non-commercial space where people can come together and celebrate diversity, openness, tolerance and freedom.

infos.headline: We don't want to give too much away. Here are the most important facts in a nutshell.

disclaimer.label: Disclaimer
disclaimer.text: This year's Klein und Haarig Gathering is a reduced version of the originally planned Klein und Haarig Festival 2024. Please take this into account in your expectations. Due to slow ticket sales and the absence of funding, which led to an increasing financial pressure and an enormous voluntary workload, we have moved away from the originally planned format. We are still looking forward to spending three even more intimate and intense days with you on our Bach Floor or in the newly designed Ambient and Chill Tent on the Wiese. All work for and contributions to the Klein und Haarig Festival are done on a voluntary basis! We highly value your appreciation and support.

first.label: Location
first.text: The Klein und Haarig Gathering will take place from June 7 to 9 at the <0> Zeltplatz Christophshof in Bad Wildbad </0>. You can enter the site from 12 pm on Friday (7.6.). Earlier arrival is unfortunately not possible.
first.text2: Admission on Friday is from 12 noon.

storno.label: Cancel ticket
storno.text: If you have already purchased a ticket for the Klein und Haarig Festival 2024 and would now like to cancel it, you can do so via the link in your booking confirmation until May 26. After this date, it will no longer be possible to cancel tickets.

refund.label: Refund
refund.text: If you have already purchased a ticket for the Klein und Haarig Festival 2024 and have paid more than EUR 115 (excl. fees), you are entitled to a refund of the excess amount paid. We will hand these over to you personally at the entrance as tokens for food and drinks. If you still have tokens left on departure, you can have them paid out at the bar. Voluntarily paid excess amounts are not refundable.

car.label: Arrival by car
car.text: Please note that this year, due to our limited financial and personnel capacities, there will be no parking spaces on site and no shuttle service to remote car parks. We therefore recommend traveling by public transport. There is a very limited number of parking spaces on site. A campervan ticket, which you can buy in our ticket shop, is required to use them. Car tickets that have already been purchased can be converted into campervan tickets at an additional cost. We will contact you personally.

publictransport.label: Arrival by public transport
publictransport.text: The nearest train station is "Bad Wildbad Bahnhof". From there, the <1>bus line 7780</1> takes you directly to the site approx. every 30 minutes - bus stop "Bad Wildbad, Zeltplatz" We’ll provide information on favorable connections (local and long-distance transport) on Instagram.

conduct.label: Code of Conduct
conduct.text:
Together with you, we want to create a non-discriminatory, non-judgmental space in which everyone feels safe and can express themselves - all participants are responsible for this.

Psychological and physical violence in the form of racist, sexist, queer-hostile and inhumane behavior of any kind will not be tolerated by us and will lead to exclusion from the event.

Please look out for others! If you notice someone who is feeling bad, someone who is being discriminated against in any way, or if your or the boundaries of others are being disregarded, do not hesitate to act! If you feel unable to cope with a situation or need support, contact the Awareness Team (you will be informed of the Awareness Person's identification symbol on site) or a person with a radio. You do not have to tell anyone directly what has happened. Just say that you want to get in touch with the awareness team (or use our code word at the bar). You will find a safe space on the site where you can get help, information or simply withdraw if you wish. Important: The power of definition always lies with the person affected. People decide for themselves when and what form of violence or discrimination they have experienced. This definition is taken seriously, perceived as true and not questioned.

Only a yes means yes! Act according to this principle of consensus and make sure to always get the consent of those around you.Please do not draw conclusions about another person's gender identity based on their external appearance. Just because you read someone as male or female does not mean that person identifies as such.

To prevent discrimination in restrooms, all restrooms are unisex during our event. In general, we ask you to remember that regardless of how you read it, people can go to any restroom they feel is right for them.

If you take a photo/video of participants and want to post it, please ask for permission or make the faces unrecognizable. Not everyone wants to be seen on the internet.

Please also pay attention to others when it comes to consumption! The open consumption of illegal drugs is prohibited on the entire festival site! We all make mistakes.

If people use discriminatory language or ways of thinking, we try to make them aware of this through constructive criticism. We ask you to be open and listen when people offer you constructive criticism.

These guidelines apply to visitors, artists and employees. If you come to our event, we expect you to abide by our rules. All performing artists will be informed in advance about our guidelines for creating safe spaces and zero tolerance for incidents. We reserve the right to cancel contracts if we determine that an artist has violated our policies.

If you are new to this kind of awareness, please inform yourself before the festival or contact the awareness team on site. The team is also available for questions and information on the topic of Safe Use and can be contacted if you are interested.

pay.label: Payment
pay.text: You can only pay with cash at the festival. There is no possibility to withdraw money.

waste.label: Waste and environmental protection
waste.text: The entire festival site is located in a water protection area. We have pledged to leave the campsite exactly as we found it. Please help us achieve this goal - use the garbage cans, garbage bags and ashtrays provided by us and do not leave defective or intact tents, pavilions or camping chairs on the site.

camp.label: Camping
camp.text: Camping is included in the gathering ticket. You can pitch your tent in the designated camping area. Please take note: A power line runs under the camping area. Pegs and tent anchors longer than 30 cm are therefore not permitted.

fire.label: Barbecue & fire
fire.text: You can prepare your own food at our barbecue area. Private barbecues are not permitted on the site. Open fires are strictly prohibited except in the central fire pit. Camping stoves are allowed.

food.label: Food
food.text: We will offer a daily changing vegetarian / vegan dish of the day as well as our signature fries.  Please note that there will be limited opening hours. The sale of food ends on Sunday at 4pm. Unfortunately we will not be selling breakfast this year.

drinks.label: Drinks
drinks.text: Fair prices for non-alcoholic drinks, as well as for beer, wine, secco, long drinks & shots. You can also bring your own drinks in normal quantities to the festival area. However, please bear in mind that we are dependent on the income from the bars to maintain our festival.

wc.label: Toilets & showers
wc.text: There are permanent sanitary facilities and hot showers on the site (as long as the gas supply lasts).Tags and graffiti are not welcome here. Otherwise we will need to have them removed at for a high cost.

secu.label: Security
secu.text: The following items are strictly prohibited at the festival: all pyrotechnics, drugs, drones, weapons of any kind and other dangerous items.

kids.label: Kinder & Minderjährige
kids.text: Children and minors may only enter the festival if accompanied by a parent or guardian. We explicitly advise against traveling to the festival with children or teenagers, as we cannot provide any quiet or rest areas. Should you still decide to do so, we expect you to be aware of your responsibility and take care of your children yourself. Children under the age of 14 do not require a ticket. Children under the age of 10 must wear ear protection. Parental tickets are not accepted. Parents are liable for their children.

animals.label: Dogs & other animals
animals.text: As we can’t set up quiet or rest areas due to the size of the site, animals are not permitted - for the benefit of your four-legged friends' health.

volunteer.headline: No KuH without volunteers. That's why we need your help. Support us during the set-up, during or after the festival with your contribution.

first.label: How does it work?
first.text: Click on "Become a volunteer" above, fill out the form and buy a gathering ticket as normal. Choose how long you would like to help us (S, M, L), when (set-up, during, after) and where (admission, food, security, etc.). You can also let us know if you have a preferred buddy and we will do our best to fulfill your wishes. Please note that due to our reduced Gathering concept this year, we will only be allocating very few volunteer shifts. Please expect not to be assigned a shift.

third.label: How will I be remunerated?
third.text: The Klein und Haarig Gathering is organized by the non-profit Bunte Platte e.V.. The entire team works on a voluntary basis, all proceeds go exclusively to the project. As a volunteer, you also support the project on a voluntary basis. You will gain an insight into how a festival is created and how it works. You will get to know the team and the many other people who make this event what it is. Nevertheless, we want to reward you for your support. You will receive a reimbursement after your work is done, the amount of which depends on the number of your shifts (but not more than the ticket price you paid). You will also be provided with food and drinks during the set-up and dismantling.

fourth.label: Do I need a ticket as a volunteer?
fourth.text: Yes, volunteers also need a gathering ticket. After filling out the volunteer form, you will receive a link to our ticket store. If you already have a ticket, you can of course still register as a volunteer.

fifth.label: I'm late or can't help after all...
fifth.text: In these cases, please contact us immediately so that we can react in time. Also the gathering is on a strict time schedule - this is the only way it can run smoothly. We rely on you.

sixth.label: When will I be assigned?
sixth.text: We will let you know well in advance so that you can plan ahead. If you have any questions, you can contact our volunteer team at any time after your registration.

organization.headline:
Hi, we are the Bunte Platte e.V.
A non-profit organization of friends and friends of friends who organize the KuH on a voluntary basis.

first.label: About us
first.text:
We are a non-profit organization based in Munich. We have been organizing the Klein und Haarig Festival for 5 years now. Initially with 40 guests, during Corona as a musical tent camp and since 2020 as a registered association with now 14 members and 350 guests. We have made it our mission to make electronic music culture tangible in all its colorful, wonderfully weird and progressive facets. We are not driven by a constant concept, but by the new and undiscovered.

Organizing the KuH in harmony with nature and celebrating it with you is the greatest thing for us.

We are always on the lookout for like-minded people who want to and can support our team or the festival. There are two ways to do this:

second.label: 1 — Join the association
second.text: If you would like to take on active tasks or responsibility in the Bunte Platte e.V. or in the organization of the Klein und Haarig Festival, please contact us directly by e-mail. We look forward to every request. If you don't want to or can't help out, but still want to support us, you can do so with an annual payment in the form of a supporting membership. To do this, tick one of the available amounts on the following membership application form and send it to us completed and signed.

third.label: 2 — Financial support
third.text: You don't want to become a member directly and want to support us financially? Here are our bank details, we are thrilled about any amount you can give

first.label: 1. Scope of application
first.text: These General Terms and Conditions (GTC) apply to participation in the festival "Klein und Haarig", which is organized by the association "Bunte Platte e.V.". By registering for the festival, participants accept these GTC.

second.label: 2. Tickets
second.text: Tickets can be purchased via the online store of the provider "www.pretix.eu". After successful payment, buyers will receive a confirmation email with the ticket QR code as a PDF attachment. This ticket QR code is the admission authorization for the festival and must be presented at the entrance in digital or printed form. The organizers assume no liability for lost or stolen tickets.

third.label: 3. Transfer, rescission and cancellation
third.text: Buyers can resell tickets via our partner <1>Ticketswap</1>. Alternatively, buyers can withdraw from the purchase contract in writing up to four weeks before the start of the festival. In this case, a cancellation fee of 12% of the ticket price will be charged. In the event of later withdrawal or no-show, no refund of the ticket price will be granted. The organizers reserve the right to cancel or postpone the festival for good cause or force majeure (weather conditions, natural events or other circumstances). In this case, the ticket prices will be refunded in full. Further claims by the purchaser are excluded.

fourth.label: 4. Admission wristband
fourth.text: Access to the festival site is only permitted with a valid admission wristband. The admission wristband will be handed out at the entrance upon presentation of a valid festival ticket and a valid ID. The admission wristband must be worn visibly on the wrist during the entire event and entitles the holder to enter the festival grounds. Re-entry is possible at any time. Upon re-entry, the admission wristband must be shown to the staff at the entrance without being asked. The organizers are not liable for damage caused by missing or damaged admission wristbands.

fifth.label: 5. Domiciliary rights
fifth.text: During the festival, the organizers have domiciliary rights. The organizers are entitled to expel persons who do not comply with the house rules or the applicable laws from the festival grounds. The organizers are not obliged to refund the festival fees if a person is expelled from the festival site due to their behavior.

sixth.label: 6. Liability
sixth.text: The organizers are not liable for damages incurred by the buyers during the festival, unless these damages are due to intentional or grossly negligent actions on the part of the organizers. The buyers are liable for damages caused by them.

seventh.label: 7. Age restriction
seventh.text: The "Klein und Haarig" festival is only open to people aged 18 and over. Participants who have not yet reached the age of 18 may only participate if accompanied by a person of legal age. The organizers reserve the right to check the age of participants upon presentation of a valid ID. Participants who have not yet reached the age of 18 and arrive unaccompanied by a person of legal age will be excluded from the festival. In this case, the purchase price of the festival ticket will not be refunded.

eigth.label: 8. Prohibited items
eigth.text: The possession and/or sale of illegal substances, weapons or other dangerous objects is prohibited. The organizers reserve the right to confiscate items, refuse access to the festival and/or expel the participants concerned from the festival grounds.

ninth.label: 9. Filming and photography
ninth.text: The organizer reserves the right to make film and photo recordings of festival visitors and to use these for marketing and promotional purposes.

tenth.label: 10. Severability clause
tenth.text: Should any provision of these GTC be or become invalid, this shall not affect the validity of the remaining provisions. The invalid provision shall be replaced by a valid provision that comes as close as possible to the economic purpose of the invalid provision. The same applies to any loopholes in these GTC.

eleventh.label: 11. Final provisions
eleventh.text: The law of the Federal Republic of Germany shall apply exclusively. Should individual provisions of these GTC be or become invalid, this shall not affect the validity of the remaining provisions. In place of the invalid provision, an appropriate provision that comes closest to the purpose of the invalid provision shall be deemed to have been agreed. The organizers reserve the right to amend these GTC at any time. Participants will be informed of changes to the GTC in good time. The changes shall be deemed accepted if the participants do not object within 14 days of notification of the changes. The place of jurisdiction for all disputes arising from these GTC is the registered office of the organizer.
